page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: There are 18 farms within our area, concentrating largely on milk production.The milk is then sold to one of the large commercial dairies but one farmer in Baltonsborough bottles and delivers his own milk.Beef cattle are also reared. There is very little crop growing apart from silage and hay. There is one farmer with a flock of sheep for commercial purposes and one with a flock of Jacob sheep, kept for their wool for spinning. We visited two apple orchards, the larger of which is five acres and contains the older type of standard apple trees. In the smaller orchard grow newer bush apple trees.The apples are used by a Taunton cider company. A year's harvest yields 20 tonnes. Using apples from smaller growers, the owner makes his own cider with traditional methods and press.
